Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.

co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: catalyst has been probed by HAADF-STEM and EXAFS.Results show that Pt single atoms confined into CTF-1 not only improved CO 2 adsorption and activation but also accelerated the separation and transfer of photogenerated carriers in CTF-1.Consequently, Pt-SACTF-1 exhibited superior photoactivity and stability, which significantly surpass the Pt nanoparticles-based CTF-1, affording CH 4 as the main reduction product.This work showcases an operable avenue to develop single-metal-atom photocatalysts and a

N 2 -saturated environment.The electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) experiment was tested by ZAHNER IM6 with a 5 mM K 3 Fe (CN) 6 5 mM K 4 Fe (CN) 6 0.1 M KCl mixed solution as electrolytes.The photocurrent data was recorded with a CHI650E electrochemical workstation with 0.2 M Na 2 SO 4 solution as electrolyte. In a typical photocatalytic CO 2 reduction experiment, 10 mg of the as-prepared photocatalyst were added into a quartz glass reactor containing 2.075 mL triethylamine (TEA) and 10 mL H 2 O.
photocatalysts and a mechanistic insight into photoreduction of CO 2 by CTF-based composite.

13 CO 2 and Dlabelled isotope experiments were examined by a gas chromatographmass spectrometer (GC-MS, Agilent 7890B-5977B).The equipped column in GC-MS analysis was CP-Molsieve 5A (Agilent Technologies, 25.0 m 0.32 mm 30 m). The photoelectrochemical experiment was conducted by a conventional three-electrodes system, in which a platinum plate electrode was used as the counter electrode and an AgAgCl electrode as the reference electrode.The working electrode was fabricated as the following process.The

878889.Based on the above analysis, it could be inferred that the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction over Pt-SACTF-1 underwent multi-step processes: (1) adsorption of CO 2 on the surface of the photocatalysts, (2) formation of intermediates products including HCOOH and HCHO, and (3) intermediates further converted into CH 4 and CO.It was also worth mentioning that the CH 4 molecule was not detected during the in-situ FTIR analysis.This could be reasoned by the nonpolar nature of the CH 4 molecule and its low

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']

Unless otherwise stated, a 300 W Xe lamp with a 420 nm cut-off filter was used as the light source.Prior to irradiation, high purity CO 2 was introduced into the reactor to evacuate any residual air completely.Then, the reaction system was sealed, irradiated, and underwent ceaseless magnetic stirring.After a specific reaction time of 4 h, the evolved products were sampled and measured with an Agilent 7890B gas chromatograph. as the following process.The well-mixed colloid (10 L) containing sample (10 mg) and N, N-dimethylformamide (1 mL) was dipped onto a fluoride-tin oxide (FTO) glass with a cover area of 0.25 cm 2 .The working electrode was dried at room temperature.The linear sweep voltammetry (LSV) curves were performed with 0.2 M Na 2 SO 4 aqueous solution as the electrolyte in an electrochemical workstation (ZAHNER IM6).The CO 2 or N 2 was bubbled into the electrolyte to keep the CO 2 or N 2 -saturated environment.The

(XAS) data was collected at BL14W1 beamline of Shanghai Synchrotron Radiation Facility (BSRF) in the fluorescence mode using a Lytle detector.Nitrogen adsorption and desorption isotherms were carried out at 77 K, and CO adsorption isotherms were detected at 273 K.
